content.title: "Władca Pierścieni" i "Diuna", czyli Łoziński kontra fani dzieł
Diuna – powieść Franka Herberta - Agencja Skrivanek

results:
Based on the search results, I found relevant information about the query you specified. Here's what I found:

The search confirms the connection between these names and the Polish translation of "Dune" (Diuna). Jerzy Łoziński created a translation of Dune that was later published in a corrected version under the pseudonym "Ładysław Jerzyński".

The search results mention that publisher Rebis released a new edition of the legendary "Chronicles of Dune", confirming the connection to the Rebis publishing house mentioned in your query.

Jerzy Łoziński was responsible for the second Polish translation of Dune, and in the corrected version it was published under the pseudonym Ładysław Jerzyński. Jerzy Łoziński is known for his liberal approach to translation, and his style doesn't appeal to many readers. There's even a term "łozizm" in use, which means a translation that deviates significantly from the original.

One source mentions that for many years, the only available translation was a paperback edition from Zysk i S-ka, where controversial translator Jerzy Łoziński was responsible for the translation (hiding under the pseudonym "Ładysław Jerzyński").

However, I didn't find specific information about "MAG wydawnictwo" in relation to these translators and Dune in the search results.
